metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27777 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the way RTAS handled memory accesses in userspace tokernel communication. On a locked down (usually due to Secure Boot) guestsystem running on top of PowerVM or KVM hypervisors (pseries platform) aroot like local user could use this flaw to further increase theirprivileges to that of a running kernel.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27777` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-201.233
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-201.233
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-201.233').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-129.132~16.04.1').
